top_comments.comment: Man, if the 64DD had come out when it was originally supposed to, we could've gotten FF7 on it and that would've been nuts.

Finally, we can digitize our minds! Tell the people, no one need die ever again! We shall live on in glorious 64 bit fidelity forever!

Oh, wait. Sigh. Never mind.

This may be the most dedication I've ever seen toward partaking in and showcasing something weird, unnecessary, and stupid, where the payoff is just not really worth it. But you did it all for us. And I applaud you for it, sir. 👏👏👏👏👏👏

comments_since_last_sample.body: (7:58) Fam-Com disk!
"You can go away." Okay, Seaman. I was leaving anyway, I promise.
lol I love all this silly shit.
Oh yes please the DD is a interesting piece of tech and thats a rabbit hole I'd like to see ya go down.

Just to be clear: Nintendo online is ridiculous. It doesn't work, and instead of giving us good ports, we get low quality emulation. My phone plays 64 games better than my Switch.... good job Nintenduh...

Did... did you say the turn of the "Willinium"????

I swear I love this channel.
The 22 people who *didn't* like this have no heart, no soul, and no place visiting this wonderful channel.

These are all the reasons why I want an N64DD. And a Hey You Pikachu! N64 that I can mod to be N64DD compatible, as the N64DD port is still in the circuit board but the Hey You Pikachu unit has no N64DD door. Of course I can get a regular N64 or use my sister's N64 we've been playing since we were kids, but I'd like my own and the Hey You Pikachu model is the one I want
I'm smashing the like button just because this was such a difficult video to put together, I want it to do well

7:35 I used that slot. Never owned a DD. A 3rd party dev kit called Doctor V64 docked with N64 through that same port, that's how I used it. I wonder if there were any other obscure peripherals that took advantage of it.

Finally, we can digitize our minds! Tell the people, no one need die ever again! We shall live on in glorious 64 bit fidelity forever!

Oh, wait. Sigh. Never mind.
